alert.note: Alert for Ray (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 26 at 4:06AM CST until January 27 at 12:08PM CST by NWS Kansas City
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Pleasant Hill MO has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Missouri... Crooked River near Richmond affecting Ray County. For the Crooked River...including Richmond...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Crooked River near Richmond. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Low-lying rural roads along with cropland and woodlands flood. At 21.0 feet, Water begins to overtop a gravel road about 1 mile south of the F and B Highway intersection. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:30 AM CST Friday the stage was 19.7 feet. - Bankfull stage is 20.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage early this morning to 20.2 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage this afternoon to 8.4 feet early Sunday morning. It will rise to 8.5 feet Sunday evening. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. This product along with additional weather and stream information is available at www.weather.gov/kc/.
